sentence.Network_en: De Gaulle was a born pedagogue who used the public platform and the television screen to great effect.
sentence.Network_cn: 戴高乐生来喜欢教育人，他充分利用了公共讲坛和电视荧屏。

sentence.Network_en: He was a french historian and pedagogue.
sentence.Network_cn: 他是法国历史学家和教育家。

sentence.Network_en: Nothing is more tiresome than a superannuated pedagogue.
sentence.Network_cn: 老朽无能的学究最令人讨厌不过。

list.abs: the papers reviewed on Bennett Reimer's work A Philosophy of Music Education from the point of view that music pedagogues how to establish own occupational conviction .本文是从音乐教育者如何确立自己的职业信仰的角度，对雷墨《音乐教育哲学》一书的评介。
training finished , all the students raised their hands wanting to be companion pedagogue .培训结束,同学们都举手要当同伴教育者。
these guileless but deep speech , come from the Liming of the person that regard Internet as pedagogue and practice .这些朴实但深刻的话语，来自作为互联网教育者和实践者的罗立明。
the education primary purpose is must make the pedagogue to become a complete person .教育的根本目的就是要使受教育者成为一个完整的人。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: via Latin from Greek paidagōgos, denoting a slave who accompanied a child to school (from pais, paid- 'boy' + agōgos 'guide')

entry.tran: 好为人师者；卖弄学问的人
entry.def: If you describe someone as a pedagogue, you mean that they like to teach people things in a firm way as if they know more than anyone else.

example.ex: De Gaulle was a born pedagogue who used the public platform and the television screen to great effect.
example.tran: 戴高乐生来喜欢教育人，他充分利用了公共讲坛和电视荧屏。
